Posts.EditableText:
I expect this has something to do with my CSS, various functions and JS that hides the command bar, but does anyone know why I don't have the '>' parser marker on my command line?

As far as I can remember, I've never had it, and it's no real biggie. The only real reason I would like it, is because with my games, if anyone inadvertently clicks somewhere on the screen, the flashing '|' disappears and it can be tricky finding the command box again, to click back into, because I choose to hide mine.
Posts.HTML:
I expect this has something to do with my CSS, various functions and JS that hides the command bar, but does anyone know why I don't have the '>' parser marker on my command line?

As far as I can remember, I've never had it, and it's no real biggie. The only real reason I would like it, is because with my games, if anyone inadvertently clicks somewhere on the screen, the flashing '|' disappears and it can be tricky finding the command box again, to click back into, because I choose to hide mine.

Posts.EditableText:
Found this in another thread asking for the same thing, but I can't make head nor tail of the instructions. I managed to strip it down to adding this to the Start Script:

[code:184am98m]request (SetInterfaceString, "TypeHereLabel= > ")[/code:184am98m]
But that gives me:

| >

When I want

> |

* | [i:184am98m][size=85:184am98m]denotes flashing cursor.[/size:184am98m][/i:184am98m]
